website_summaries.verdict: Brooks’ attempt to upgrade the well-loved Addiction Walker has been partially successful. While some people enjoy its supportive built and improved design, the majority of those who used the first version have been frustrated. The 2nd iteration appears to fall short of the comfort, grip, and craftsmanship of the first Walker.
pros: Those who spend many hours on their feet highly recommend the Addiction Walker 2 for its lasting comfort
The shoe has helped in alleviating foot pain for some of the wearers
Many users claim that the second iteration has significantly improved in the aesthetics department
More than a few users appreciate the presence of arch support in this walking shoe
The basic color options of this model easily match formal work outfits and uniforms, says multiple reviews
cons: Many fans of the original model were disappointed with the new version: it appears stiffer, less comfortable, and cheaper-feeling than the first shoe
A couple of testers warn that the outsole isn’t as slip-resistant as they had hoped

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk
customer_reviews.text: After wearing a pair of Brooks shoes daily for almost 2 years it was time for a new pair. Unfortunately I bought these. First problem is they are synthetic especially where it counts, the eyelets. It's been less that 2 months and already laces are pulling through the cheap material and busting out the eyelets. I'm not lacing all that tight but I can see all of the eyelet holes stretching. I doubt I'll get another month out of these. Dollar Store quality at a premium price.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W.

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long.
customer_reviews.text: My doctor recommended these to me for my work. At first they were great, I stop having pains in my legs and everything. But after only a month the sole wore down to nothing and I started having pains again. For the price and how fast they wore out it is not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: joey lowery

customer_reviews.title: Addiction two
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased brooks for many years. I am a postal worker use my own money to purchase because they won't let us buy with uniform allowances. I was skeptical when I couldn't get original walkers. I tried new addiction 2. In 2 months they are extremely painful. No support no comfort. My old ones would last 6 months! Old enough to know new and improved means cheaper less quality. Don't buy if you owned original Walker Walker addiction
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband because I have a pair and and they are so comfortable he really is hard on shoes he's worn these to work now for several weeks and he's liking them has well great arch support and the soles are holding up nicely
customer_reviews.author: Lora

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t help my plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from plantar fasciitis/ heel spurs and was hoping that these shoes with their insoles with the help with the pain... They did not. The heel portion of the insoles were flattened, after wearing them three times. My heels were in pain! I have to use my custom orthotics in them to wear them at all. Not what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E

customer_reviews.title: Great quality super comfortable good looking shoe.
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable. They have a lot of cushioning and support. They are high quality leather, with nice detailing. I have bought cheaper shoes in the past...these are lots better in every way. I believe they will last longer. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Gramma

customer_reviews.title: Painful and not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this show for my dad because he stands all day at work. He wore it once and started complaining about feeling pain and discomfort. Amazon would let me return the show and I wasted my money
customer_reviews.author: Eidah

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I thought they would feel like the original Brooks Mens Addiction Walker. Those were some of the most comfortable shoes I have found. These shoes feel completely difference. The originals seemed to have far more arch support and helped with my plantar fasciitis. These shoes seem to have more padding on the blade of the foot. Since buying these my feet and ankles have been hurting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sent a Velcro shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Received a Velcro shoe when obviously the picture shows shoe strings. Will be retiring the shoes but would like to purchase the shoes shown in the picture with the shoe string option.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Ledet

customer_reviews.title: Relief for plantar fasciaitis
customer_reviews.text: These have significantly reduced pain of plantar fasciatis. Not the most attractive but very functional.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G. Reagin

customer_reviews.title: Nice out the box.
customer_reviews.text: They look good and definitely have a highly noticeable support difference compared to my current work shoes. Id rather spend this kind of money on some flashier designer shoes but Im willing to invest in making my life easier. Will update. Wearing them to my shift tonight. Update: One month later so far so good. There was a week long break in period but they became comfortable very quickly. Not as slip resistant as advertised though so if you're clumsy or uncoordinated these may not be for you. They've been able to stand the straight up abuse at my job and are very water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Koran Turner

customer_reviews.title: Ok shoe for work
customer_reviews.text: Not super soft in the sole. I am used to Koka 1 1 so . . . i guess they work. I walk about 6 to 8 miles a day and my feet are ok at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Done

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable walking shoe ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of Addictions in 7 years. They are exceptionally comfortable and supportive and very durable. I've had tarsal tunnel surgery on both feet and normally wear custom made orthotic inserts or my feet hurt terribly. My podiatrist recommended the Brooks Addiction shoe and I wear them without inserts pain free. I'll continue to wear them as long as Brooks makes them!
customer_reviews.author: William J Roseberry

customer_reviews.title: Great for sagging ankles
customer_reviews.text: Since the change of manufacturers the shoe now runs about 1/2 size smaller than what is advertised. I think the first addition shoes made in China that were $40 dollars less ($85)were a bit better quality that 2 edition style ($125) made in Vietnam.
customer_reviews.author: David C Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 Size Smaller than Version 1
customer_reviews.text: I've had 7 to 8 sets of Brooks Addiction Walker shoes, all size 10 1/2 Wide (2E). Perfect fit. This is a new model and runs a bit smaller than the original version, much to my chagrin. I should have returned before using for my daily walk. After 5 miles I realized the shoe was smaller than I was accustom to. Another 20 miles of walking hasn't changed the situation. When I place the original next to the new version I see a 1/4" difference. in length Next pair will definitely be for size 11 Wide (2E). Other than sizing, same great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Just not that comfortable. Very slippery when wet.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my feet all day. I purchased these on a recommendation from my Chiropractor and was expecting them to be a good all day shoe. they really are not. my feet get sore in them pretty quickly actually. I've owned other way less expensive shoes that did a much better job. Also the soles are extremely slick when on most even very slightly damp surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dimmen

customer_reviews.title: Comfort is beautiful
customer_reviews.text: My wife hates the look of these shoes; she says I look like I need a walker. The shoes look fine to me, but the comfort? Beautiful! I wear them everywhere! I tried to wear some regular shoes once and my feet lasted a couple hours. I know better now.
customer_reviews.author: Brute

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe.  Durable and extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: On feet all day at work and these shoes are like walking on air. VERY worth the money!! Last pair of Brooks lasted 9 months of EVERYDAY wear. Work/Casual. Love them!!
customer_reviews.author: Rufus and Rasha

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for foot footed clients with comfort
customer_reviews.text: Great football particularly if you are flat footed and want a stable shoe. It's also very comfortable and one of my husband's favorite shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoe Ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite shoes. I wear them so much that I usually have to replace them every year or two.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyVA

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I work in retail and walk on a concrete pour 10+ hours every day. My foot pains are gone the shoes are great I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Marciano

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe
customer_reviews.text: Brooks hands down are the best sneaker. Comfort, durability, and support! Perfect for work!!
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Green

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and durability
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my walking exercise. They are comfortable and well cushioned. Most of my walking is on cement or gravel roads so the sole thickness And cushioning is important. This is my fourth or fifth pair. My only complaint is that these shoes arrive with the shoestrings laced too tightly. I just relace them and all is well.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Miner

customer_reviews.title: Brooks Addiction # 2
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what the seller described very satisfied with my purchase highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Rebel

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It has just been a day, but it seems like a very comfortable shoe. Good padding. It does run short. I had to return the first and buy 1/2 a size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Saumitra Sinha

customer_reviews.title: UPS man
customer_reviews.text: Husband is a UPS driver and on his feet all day. So far he loves them. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Manaugar

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe to have
customer_reviews.text: This is a lite weight shoe that is comfortable to wear on the job walking. I have been wearing Brooks for 2 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe the first time to deal with the problems of a neuroma in my foot. It was comfortable and a good fit but I decided the half-size larger shoe would be a better fit. The second purchase was for the half-size larger and that was a good decision. The shoe is very comfortable. Although the ad says, "Order true to size," that may not be true in every case.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Appearance is pathetic
customer_reviews.text: For 140 bucks...this shoe should look respectable. It looks like I bought it off the Kmart clearance rack .i guess brooks got rid of the brown seude upper. My wife said...that shoe will look great when you are 90.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Super fast delivery and my FIL is a notorious walker, like 13km a day... he LOVES these shoes. Super supportive and durable.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: You can put them on and start walking--no break-in needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit through to size. Excellent quality. Very comfortable and give great support on the arch.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Poor product. Seem split after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these for work. The seam on top of the shoe is starting split after almost 2 months from purchase date. Seems like they should last longer than this. Won’t be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Aaron O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Have worn Brooks Addiction for several years. The Addiction 2 is just as comfortable as the first Addiction. Sizing is true.
customer_reviews.author: MaryD

customer_reviews.title: Runs small in size
customer_reviews.text: Ordered extra wide. Shoe not wide as previous Brooks shoe I have ordered in the past
customer_reviews.author: gerald dunn

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: My husband has worn these shoes for 1 week and on both shoes the front rubber part of the sole that comes up on the front of the shoe has come unattached and is now flapping. The shoes are not cheap and would not expect this to happen so fast for a “high quality” sneaker
customer_reviews.author: Robin Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Good walker
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable out of the box. Do not wear thick socks as the size runs definitely toward a thin sock
customer_reviews.author: The Walker

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are very roomy and comfortable shoes, especially for wide feet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Essential footwear for health care workers
customer_reviews.text: We are health care workers always on our feet,many times in wetness .We rely on these shoes .True to size...not stylish but comfortable. We only get black
customer_reviews.author: MCK

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Lots of support. Others advised that these shoes run a little narrow, and a half size short. I ordered accordingly, and was pleasently surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Randal R

customer_reviews.title: 10 years and still like them
customer_reviews.text: I have an implant in both knees. My doctor recommended Addiction. I have been trough many pairs. How about a spiff on the next pair? dvmills0294@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Don Mills

customer_reviews.title: Love The Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes. Light weight but supportEd. This is my 4th pair. Miss the brown ones. Please bring them back
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Bryan Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Not as depicted
customer_reviews.text: Picture shows leather but the shoes are mesh. Needed a leather shoe so returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Kee

customer_reviews.title: Walking Shoes ??
customer_reviews.text: The rubber on the toes came unglued after about 2 weeks. Wrote a question on Amazon to company about the issue and never heard back. Now the return window has closed.
customer_reviews.author: Robin K Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend Brooks Mens Walker shoe. It is true to size and very comfortable for my daily 5 mile walks.
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: I am ordering another pair for work
customer_reviews.text: I used them to go walking every morning for 3 miles Great stability and feet doesn’t ache anymore
customer_reviews.author: timothy john walker

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I stand for 7 hours and these are the best. Only had about 3 weeks but make big difference.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Callahan

product_meta.title: Brooks Men's Addiction Walker 2 Running Shoes
feature_bullets: MAXIMUM SUPPORT: The extended Progressive Diagonal Rollbar (PDRB) is a support system for your entire body. It strategically positions arch support to guide and keep your body in its natural path of motion.
ALL-DAY COMFORT: BioMoGo DNA, proprietary cushioning, adapts to your stride, weight and speed. It can helps protect you by reducing impact on your joints.
The full-grain leather upper is both comfortable and durable.
The new outsole is certified slip-resistant
